reasoning: Bacterial sepsis in newborns within 72 hours of birth. Epidemiological studies report 3-5 cases per 1000 live births (~3-5 per 100k person-years in neonatal population). Global estimate ~300 per 100k includes all births. Varies by region, obstetric care quality, and maternal factors.
source: Lawn JE et al. (2005). Neonatal survival: a call for action. Lancet. 365(9465):1189-1197
